issues.title: Profile value update
issues.author: SimonFrost-Arm
issues.body: Note that as per DEN0137 1.0 Rel0 changes, the profile for CCA is modified to "tag:arm.com,2023:cca_platform#1.0.0" for the platform component. This release also introduced an (optional) profile for the realm component with value "tag:arm.com,2023:realm#1.0.0".

issues.title: Clarify whether Arm CCA platform config is mandatory or optional?
issues.author: yogeshbdeshpande
issues.body:
In the CCA Endorsement draft it is not clear whether the supply chain has to provide 
Arm CCA Platform Configuration or one can omit if the Config Parameter is not used..?

As per RMM specification:
`The CCA platform config claim is expected to contain the System Properties field which is present in the Root
Non-volatile Storage (RNVS) public parameters.`

This issue tracks need for a clear documentation of this aspect in the next revision of the specification!

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
There are at least three things to tease out about this claim:

1. Exact semantics
2. Optionality
3. Matching criteria

comments.author: yogeshbdeshpande
comments.body: I am not convinced about item 3. The Platform  Config, as received in Evidence should be an exact match of the Config as supplied in Reference Value, so 3. is not really something to tease about!

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
> I am not convinced about item 3. The Platform Config, as received in Evidence should be an exact match of the Config as supplied in Reference Value, so 3. is not really something to tease about!

If the config ID is organised as a bitmap, with bit positions indicating specific platform features/settings, it makes sense for the verifier to check that only those of interest are enabled, and be neutral about others.

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
As per LIS conversation:

1. To encode the expected Platform Config we will use a `raw-value` of type `tagged-mask-raw-value`.
2. The associated `mkey` is `"arm-platform-config”`.

issues.title: Remove Realm Class Variables
issues.author: yogeshbdeshpande
issues.body:
The Realm Class Variables namely:
1. Realm Class ID
2. Realm Vendor ID 
needs to be removed, as they do not appear in the CCA Realm Evidence Token.

Hence they are of no use in Evidence to Reference Value matching phase in CoRIM Verifier and as such cannot be part of the CCA Endorsement story!

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
> Hence they are of no use in Evidence to Reference Value matching phase in CoRIM Verifier and as such cannot be part of the CCA Endorsement story!

Vendor *can* be part of the CCA endorsement story, but as an explicit "endorsed value” rather than piggybacked on the `environment-map`.

This would require adding a new `vendor` attribute to CoRIM's `measurement-values-map`, which is not available in corim-07.

issues.title: Redefine Realm Reference Values, using Mkey semantics
issues.author: yogeshbdeshpande
issues.body:
Currently, Realm Reference Values (namely CCA RIM and CCA REM) are expressed using, Integrity Registers.

With the decision to remove Integrity Registers, need to re-model RIM and REM using `mkey` and `mval`, as the base semantics.

The new CoRIM draft allows expressing multiple Measurement Maps for an Environment so the expression of RIM and REM using the new semantics is the correct representation.

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
The mapping is as follows:

| Realm claim name | `mkey` name | `mval` value |
|---|---|---|
| Realm Initial Measurement (RIM) | `rim` | `digests` |
| Realm Extensible Measurements (REM) | `rem${i}` where `i` is the index 0..3 in the array | `digests` |
| [Realm Personalisation Value (RPV) | `rpv` | `raw-value` of type `tagged-bytes` |

issues.title: Align CCA Platform Measurements with CoRIM Draft 07
issues.author: yogeshbdeshpande
issues.body:
The current CCA Endorsement Draft 01, uses `cca-platform-sw-component`, which is a profile specific representation.

However  [CoRIM specification Draft 07 ](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-rats-corim/) has enough measurement map semantics to express the CCA Platform Software Components to be expressed using the base types.

This issue tracks the changes needed in the spec to represent `cca-platform-sw-component` using base CoRIM types!

comments.author: thomas-fossati
comments.body:
The mapping is as follows:

| [`arm-platform-sw-component`](https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ffm-rats-cca-token-01.html#section-4.6.1) field  | CoRIM's [`measurement-values-map`](https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ietf-rats-corim-07.html#section-5.1.4.1.4.2) field |
|---|---|
| component type | `name` |
| version | `version` (without optional version scheme) |
| signer id | `cryptokeys` of type `tagged-bytes` |
| measurement value & hash algorithm identifier | `digests` |

Alternatively, an `mkey` of type `tstr` could be used to encode the component name.

issues.title: CBOR tags related actions
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body:
1. We need to decide which, among PSA and CCA, defines 600 (i.e., Implementation ID)
2. We need to remove 601 as part of #6

issues.title: Describe CCA evidence transformation
issues.author: thomas-fossati
issues.body: Add a section that describes how evidence in CCA token format is transformed into CoRIM internal representation.

comments.author: yogeshbdeshpande
comments.body: @thomas-fossati please review!

* s/uri/URI/
* the profile attribute is not multi-valued anymore

I suggest:

> The profile attribute in the CoRIM MUST be present and MUST be the URI `tag:arm.com,2025:cca_platform#1.0.0` as shown in {{ex-cca-platform-profile}}.

ditto

Plus, it’s `tag:arm.com,2023:realm#1.0.0` in CCA token, why diverge?
ditto
No we have not introduced it in 2023, but now we are introducing it in 2025, so I think, it is more correct to state the year, we introduced this...

What I am asking is: why do we need to define similar but different profiles than the ones defined in the CCA token I-D?

IMO, if there are no compelling reasons, we should fully align.

Remember the one in this draft are Endorsement profiles and not Evidence Profiles. They can be different in names, format and year of introduction. While if you see, semantically they are `aligned`, its just the year of introduction is different.
I have made the valid suggestions, thanks for these!
They are the same but for a single digit.  I bet this is going to become a neverending source of confusion.
If we really want to distinguish from the EAT profile URIs, they should be changed in more meaningful ways than just the date.  Remember that the EAT profiles could also change in the future.
In fact, I would make them separate, to state that this is a profile for CCA Platform endorsement, while the one in the `CCA token draft` is a profile for platform evidence! Same for Realm!
As the profile tag here (in this draft) and the profile tag in cca token draft has different interpretation/meaning!

How about:
`tag:arm.com,2025:cca_platform_endorsements#1.0.0`

`tag:arm.com,2025:cca_realm_endorsements#1.0.0`
That’s slightly better, but I still don’t understand the need for duplication.  The evidence and endorsements profiles should go hand in hand, there is no reason for one to differ from the other.

Here is my take: Each URI tag is Unique and it should have a precise meaning.

So if `tag:arm.com,2025:cca_platform_endorsements#1.0.0` is understood that should reflect precisely that it is conveying CoRIM CCA Endorsement Profile and nothing about CCA Evidence.

If we use clashing names, it creates confusion, to what the meaning of tag implies !

OK, we agree to disagree.

I’ll drop my point.  Let’s move on.

pulls.title: cleanup
pulls.author: thomas-fossati
pulls.body:
* align title with PSA
* minor grammar fixes
* clean up references

(not exhaustive, just a start)

comments.author: yogeshbdeshpande
comments.body: @thomas-fossati Thanks for the changes: Most of them I agree and so would Approve the PR!

```suggestion
title: A CoRIM Profile for Arm's Confidential Computing Architecture (CCA) Endorsements
```
@thomas-fossati Now that CoRIM is widely used for many purposes, Concise Evidence and others it is very important to use the word Endorsements to highlight it is a CoRIM profile for Endorsements
